title: MUSIAL build configuration
description: JSON schema to validate and document the MUSIAL build task configuration.

minimalCoverage.description: The minimal depth of coverage wrt. reads of a variant to be accepted. Extracted from the DP attribute of input .vcf files.

minimalHomozygousFrequency.description: The minimal frequency wrt. reads supporting a homozygous allele call for a variant to be accepted. Extracted from the AF attribute of input .vcf files.

minimalHeterozygousFrequency.description: The minimal frequency wrt. reads supporting a heterozygous allele call for a variant to be accepted. Extracted from the AF attribute of input .vcf files.

maximalHeterozygousFrequency.description: The maximal frequency wrt. reads supporting a heterozygous allele call for a variant to be accepted. Extracted from the AF attribute of input .vcf files.

minimalQuality.description: The minimal call quality for a variant to be accepted. Extracted from the QUALITY attribute of input .vcf files.

excludedPositions.description: Positions that shall be excluded from the analysis.

referenceSequenceFile.description: Path to a .fasta file; Content will be used as reference genome.

referenceFeaturesFile.description: Path to a .gff or .gff3 file; Content will be used as reference genome feature annotation.

output.description: Path pointing to a file; Content will be used as output file path.

samples.description: Object specifying the set of samples to analyze.

^.+$.description: Object representing one single sample to analyze. The property key will be used as the internal sample name.

vcfFile.description: .vcf file matching the format described in http://samtools.github.io/hts-specs/VCFv4.3.pdf.

^.^$.description: Any string key/value pairs that will be included as meta-information for the sample in the output file.

samplesDirectory.description: Path to a directory. All .vcf files contained in the directory will be treated as samples (without annotation).

features.description: Object specifying the set of features to match from the provided `referenceGFF` that shall be analyzed.

^.+$.description: Object representing one feature to analyze. The property key will be used as the internal feature name.

pdbFile.description: Path pointing to a .pdb format (https://www.wwpdb.org/documentation/file-format-content/format33/v3.3.html) file. If specified the structure contained within the file will be used as protein product of this feature and triggers proteoform analysis.

coding.description: Whether to consider this feature as coding sequence. This will trigger proteoform analysis, even without a specified `pdbFile`.

^.^$.description: Any string key/value pairs that will be included as meta-information for the feature in the output file.

^match_.^$.description: String key (key has to be match_X, with X being the attribute name in the .gff file)/value pairs that will be used to match feature information from specified .gff.
